title: Unsupervised Learning
subject: Data Science
theory: Learning without a teacher. The algorithm tries to find structure in the data itself. Common tasks: Grouping similar users (Clustering) or simplifying complex data (Dimensionality Reduction).

common_mistakes.correction: Results are subjective. There is no 'ground truth' to calculate accuracy. Validation is harder (Silhouette Score).
common_mistakes.example: Is this cluster 'High Value Customers' or 'Big Spenders'?

interview_questions.question: How do you evaluate clustering performance?
interview_questions.answer: Internal metrics like Silhouette Score or Davies-Bouldin Index. External metrics if labels exist (Rand Index).

real_world_use_cases.description: Grouping 1M customers into 5 segments based on buying behavior to target marketing.

summary: Unsupervised learning reveals the hidden structure of data.
